intro: Isoetes histrix subsp. sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian water horsetail, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, segmented stems and small, spore-producing cones. This subspecies is typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and marshes. Its morphology includes whorls of small, needle-like leaves that help in photosynthesis. The plant plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
